name: Hampton Inn Charlotte - South Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on a Friday night for a birthday celebration. The location is perfect for what we wanted to do--walk to Dean and Delucca's Wine Room for a lovely lunch, go a few steps for an early afternoon movie, wander into the many upscale stores, have a drink at the Palm, go back to the hotel to dress for a meal at the Upstream. All of these locations are on one pleasantly walkable street--along with P.F. Chang's and Wolfgang Puck. A French bistro (can't remember the name) is right behind the hotel--again a few steps away.
reviews.title: A cross between a Hilton and a Hampton
Good location & service
reviews.text: The hotel itself is much more upscale than a Hampton Inn; in fact, it's more upscale than many Hiltons. Our room (standard) was quite large and furnished much more nicely than the usual Hilton hotel. There was even a jet tub with a mirrored wall located in its own alcove. The bathroom was nice with a TV in the mirror over the vanity.
The lobby is beautiful and luxuriously appointed, and the people in reception are friendly and accommodating. The exterior of the hotel is quite imposing at the end of the street.
reviews.title: Business Traveler

reviews.text: So why as I giving this hotel a 4 instead of a 5? 1) The bath amenities (soap, lotion, etc.) are very basic--the same ones used in an ordinary HI off an interstate. 2) The toweling is also very basic--small and thin. 3) No glassware at all--only paper cups. 4) The nightly rate (even weekend) is high, which is understandable given the location and the physical accommodations of the hotel; however, the low quality of the bath amenities, toweling, and lack of glassware do detract from an otherwise excellent hotel experience. It almost seems as though the owners can't decide if this is a Hilton (a nice one!) or a Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Beautiful and extremely clean hotel

reviews.text: Would we stay here again? Yes--the overall experience at this beautiful hotel outweighs the the downside.
reviews.title: Ritz of Hampton's

reviews.text: I am sure this is the nicest Hampton in the world because it is nearly the nicest of all Hilton properties I've stayed in including some five star properties. Very clean, quiet, comfortable, great location TV in the mirror is cool. This Hampton was built with very high quality. It is unlike any other. Choose this hotel over any other property, even full service Marriott or Doubletree because this place is much nicer. Restaurants are right outside the door from PF Changs to the Palm Steakhouse.
reviews.title: Nicest Hampton in the world
Best hotel in a LONG time
reviews.text: I stayed here a while ago, and I couldn't be more pleased with this hotel. We came down for just 1 night for a race, but I begged to stay longer although we could not.

Pros: area (right in the center of shopping outlets and restaurants *MUST TRY PINKBERRY), Fountain (the simplest lion fountain in front of the hotel added the perfect touch to this already perfect hotel), rooms (very spacious, even with TVs in the bathroom mirrors!), pool (secluded, perfect for a private leisurely swim), breakfast (wide variety of complimentary foods)
reviews.title: Hotel

reviews.text: Cons: some staff members (had trouble checking in, not a very patient staff woman, but was soon replaced by wonderful young man)
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable and Convenient

reviews.text: All in all, I give this hotel 5 out of 5 stars. The only con of the one staff member can be understood as everyone has their bad days. I would recommend this hotel for either friend, romantic, or family vacations. This hotel suits everyone. Best hotel I've stayed at in a VERY long time.
reviews.title: WOW! An amazing place, highly recommended.

reviews.text: This was THE nicest Hampton Inn that I've stayed in and felt more like a 5 star hotel. No complaints whatsoever and will definitely stay again. I was here for a business trip and my company booked the hotel, but I was more than pleased with the accommodations.
reviews.title: Felt very first class!

reviews.text: This place is a Hampton Inn in name only - it's more like a high end Hilton Garden Inn. Can't say enough positives about this hotel. Great location, new hotel, flat screen TVs with HD programming, a TV in the mirror in the bathroom, fantastic staff, well kept usual Hampton Inn breakfast. It's on par or better with most HGIs and better than some Hilton hotels.
reviews.title: Hands down, the best Hampton Inn I've ever been to
Top of the Line Accomodations
reviews.text: This location is the best Hampton Inn we have visited. Excellent setting. Beautiful lobby. Allowed us early check-in with no aggravation. Our suite was a pleasant surprise. Even though near a shopping area it was quiet. Will definitely stay here the next time we are in Charlotte.

clean friendly beautiful great safe upscale location. TV in the mirror in the bathroom walk in showers and a separate Jacuzzi tub staff was fantastic. everything was very clean staff went out of their way to make me feel at home.
reviews.title: beyond what I was expecting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed here before and loved the hotel and its location. While more expensive than most Hampton Inns, it is in a very upscale area, offering great shopping and restaurants within 5 minutes drive or walk. Very safe area. The complimentary breakfast is the same as all other Hampton Inns which seems out of place in such a luxurious-appearing hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in great location

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in this hotel from Jul 27 to August 2, 2013 for a business purpose. I think the advantage of staying in this hotel is very close to shopping center and (big) mall with plenty of choices for foods. The only problem is the price. USD 150 a night is too much for this quality of a hotel.
reviews.title: Nice but pricey
